intro: Thesium glabrum, commonly known as the smooth thesium, is a flowering plant native to parts of Australia. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Thesium glabrum is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and scrublands.
